title: Why Regulators Are Worried About Stablecoins
sub_head: These cryptocurrencies account for about $160 billion in market value, up from about $11 billion two years ago
body:
The recent collapse of a cryptocurrency from its $1 level has heightened regulatorsâ€™ concerns that other dollar-pegged assets could crumble.
Deemed stablecoins for their supposed lack of volatility, these assets have become a larger part of the digital-asset ecosystem over the last two years. Stablecoins account for about $160 billion in market value, up from almost $11 billion in June 2020.
